data.title: Athletes Born on March 19
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in sport for the 19th of March. Browse birthdays of sports stars, managers and coaches that were born on March 19.
data.text:
Edward J. McKeever, American baseball executive (co-owner Brooklyn Dodgers), born in Brooklyn, New York (d. 1925)

Schofield Haigh, English cricket fast bowler (11 Tests, 24 wickets, BB 6/11; Yorkshire CCC), born in Berry Brow, Yorkshire, England (d. 1921)

Léon Scieur, Belgian cyclist (d. 1969)

Attilio Demaria, Argentinian footballer (d. 1990)

Jay Berwanger, American College Football Hall of Fame halfback (1st Heisman Trophy winner 1935, Chicago), born in Dubuque, Iowa (d. 2002)

Norman Yardley, English cricket batsman and captain (20 Tests; Wisden Cricketer of the Year 1948), born in Barnsley, Yorkshire (d. 1989)

Laszlo Szabo, Hungarian chess player (d. 1998)

Bobby Brown, Scottish soccer goalkeeper (5 caps; Rangers, Falkirk) and manager (St Johnstone; Scottish national team 1967-71), born in Dunipace, Scotland (d. 2020)

Richie Ashburn

American Baseball Hall of Fame infielder (6 × MLB All-Star; NL batting champion 1955, 58; Philadelphia Phillies) and sportscaster (Phillies TV 1963-71), born in Tilden, Nebraska

Clive Van Ryneveld, South African cricket all-rounder (1951-58), born in Cape Town, Union of South Africa (d. 2018)

Jim Phelan, American college basketball coach (Mount Saint Mary's University 1954–2003), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 2021)

Gay Brewer, American golfer (US Masters 1967), born in Middletown, Ohio (d. 2007)

Ben Lexcen, Australian yacht designer (Australia II 1983 America's Cup), born in Boggabri, Australia (d. 1988)

Carlo Mazzone, Italian soccer manager (Ascoli, Fiorentina, Roma, Napoli, Bologna, Cagliari) and centre-back (AS Roma, SPAL, Ascoli), born in Rome, Italy (d. 2023)

Abbas Ali Baig, cricketer (Indian bat 112 on debut v England 1959)

1939 Joe Kapp, American College / Canadian Football HOF quarterback (UC Berkeley; NFL C'ship & Pro Bowl 1969 Minnesota Vikings; CFL Grey Cup 1964 BC Lions; CFL All-Star 1963, 64), born in Santa Fe, New Mexico (d. 2023)

1939 Peter Thorburn MNZM, New Zealand rugby union coach (North Harbour, NZ sevens, Bristol RFC, United States), born in Auckland, New Zealand (d. 2021)

Vern Schuppan, Australian racing driver who won 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1983, born in Booleroo Centre, South Australia

Mohammad Ilyas, cricketer (Pakistani batsman in ten Tests 1964-69)

Earlie Fires, American jockey (Hialeah Park), born in Rivervale, Arkansas

1947 Marinho Peres, Brazilian soccer defender & captain (15 caps; Portuguesa, Santos, FC Barcelona, Inter Milan, Galícia) and manager (Botafogo, El Salvador, Belenenses, Sporting, Santos), born in Sorocaba, São Paulo, Brazil (d. 2023)

Seasick Steve [Steven Gene Wold], American blues musician (Sonic Soul Surfer), born in Oakland, California

Warren Lees, NZ cricket wicket-keeper (late 70's)

Hans Rinn, German DR, 2 man lugist (Olympic gold 1976, 80)

Andy Reid, American football coach (Philadelphia Eagles 1999–2012; Super Bowl 2020, 23 Kansas City Chiefs), born in Los Angeles, California

Jos Lansink, Dutch-Belgian equestrian

Ivan Calderón, Puerto Rican baseball outfielder (MLB All Star 1991; Chicago White Sox, Montreal Expos), born in Fajardo, Puerto Rico (d. 2003)

Sergey Dmitriyev, Russian soccer striker (6 caps USSR; Zenit Saint Petersburg, CSKA Moscow), born in Saint Petersburg, Russia (d. 2022)

Andy Sinton, English footballer

Vladimir Konstantinov, Russian ice hockey player

Arjan Vermeulen, soccer player (Vitesse)

Errol Refos, soccer player (Feyenoord)

1970 Janne Laukenen, Lahti FIN, NHL defenseman (Finland Olympic bronze 1998, Senators)

1970 Rick Mirer, NFL quarterback (Seattle Seahawks, Chicago Bears)

1970 Sean Fleming, CFL placekicker & punter (Grey Cup 1993, 2003, 05; CFL All-Star 2002, 04 Edmonton Eskimos), born in Burnaby, British Columbia

Kirk Botkin, NFL tight end (New Orleans Saints, Pittsburgh Steelers)

1971 Louie Debrusk, Canadian NHL left wing (Edmonton Oilers, and three other teams), born in Cambridge, Ontario

1971 Marty Moore, NFL inside linebacker (NE Patriots)

1971 Taase Faumui, Samoan-American NFL defensive linebacker (Pittsburgh Steelers, 1994-95; Oakland Raiders, 1997), born in Western Samoa

1971 Whitney Hedgepeth, American swimmer - 100m/200m backstroke (2 Olympic silver medals 1996), born in Charlottesville, Virgina

Nate Quarry, American mixed martial arts fighter (The Ultimate Fighter; co-host MMA Uncensored Live), born in Arcata, California

John Michels, American NFL tackle, 1996-99 (Green Bay Packers-Super Bowl XXXI, Philadelphia Eagles), and radiologist, born in La Jolla, California

John Coppinger, pitcher (Baltimore Orioles), born in El Paso, Texas

Antonio Daniels, NBA guard (Vancouver Grizzlies)

Alessandro Nesta, Italian footballer

Christos Patsatzoglou, Greek footballer

1979 Hedo Türkoğlu, Turkish basketball player

1979 Hee-Seop Choi, Korean baseball player

1979 Ivan Ljubičić, Croatian tennis player

Kolo Touré, Ivorian footballer

Brad Jones, Australian footballer

1982 Jonathan Fanene, American football player

Ernesto Viso, Venezuelan racing driver

Michal Švec, Czech footballer
